intro: Stenomesson campodense, commonly known as the campodense daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flower heads composed of ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows in open, grassy areas and has a compact, upright habit. Its leaves are linear and hairy, while the flowers are usually white or pale yellow. Stenomesson campodense is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
